text: Amephana anarrhini is a moth of the family Noctuidae. It is found in Italy, southern France and the Iberian Peninsula. The wingspan is 28–32 mm. Adults are on wing from April to June in one generation per year. The larvae feed on Helianthemum nummularium. ==References== ==External links== *Lot Moths and Butterflies *Lepiforum.de Category:Cuculliinae Category:Moths of Europe Category:Moths described in 1840 Category:Taxa named by Philogène Auguste Joseph Duponchel
title: Amephana anarrhini
